definition: to send (sb) away/to change the subject/to open (an umbrella etc)
surname Zhi
to support/to sustain/to erect/to raise/branch/division/to draw money/classifier for rods such as pens and guns, for army divisions and for songs or compositions

to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format

sentences.english: As if to be rid of her, Ma handed Sadie a broom.
sentences.chinese: 好像要支开她似的，妈递给莎蒂一个扫帚。

sentences.english: Meng Ni hold dad and Zhang Ma chat alone.
sentences.chinese: 孟妮支开了爸爸与张妈单独聊天。

sentences.english: Get your father out of the way for a few minutes while I wrap his present.
sentences.chinese: 把你爸爸支开一会儿，我在给他包礼品。

definition: to send sb away (with an excuse)
to send away/to dismiss (servants etc)/to retire from public life
to find an excuse

to drive out/to oust
to pass on a story/to communicate a message
to leave in stealth/to slip away

to monitor secretly/to spy on
